q: interview excerpt from " Colin Powell , George H. W. Bush 's first secretary of state,`` did not, in my view, do a good job of managing the people under him,'' Donald Rumsfeld said. " There was a lot of leaking out of the State Department, and the George H. W. Bush knew it, he said.`` And it was unhelpful. And most of it ended up making the State Department look good. We didn't do that in the Pentagon. I insisted we not do it.''

and says she can see similarities between her on-screen role and the pop mogul.`` If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell ,'' Jane Lynch explains. You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her. He's a great inspiration for the character. Jane Lynch went on to tell The Sun:`` Simon Cowell and Sue say the things people wish they could in their jobs or at their school, but can't because it's not the done thing. Just like him, she says what she wants because she can. STB) is on his way out. In a memo to Microsoft employees, CEO Steve Ballmer made it clear that Muglia's departure signals a shift in the direction the company intends to pursue. I have decided that now is the time to put new leadership in place for STB. This is simply recognition that all businesses go through cycles and need new and different talent to manage through those cycles, Steve Ballmer wrote in his email to the troops.
